content:
\bibitem{ye2020clairvoyance}
Jiaming Ye, Mingliang Ma, Yun Lin, Yulei Sui, and Yinxing Xue.
\newblock Clairvoyance: Cross-contract static analysis for detecting practical
  reentrancy vulnerabilities in smart contracts.
\newblock In {\em Proceedings of the ACM/IEEE 42nd International Conference on
  Software Engineering: Companion Proceedings}, pages 274--275, 2020.

\bibitem{yu2023money}
Lei Yu, Fengjun Zhang, Jiajia Ma, Li~Yang, Yuanzhe Yang, and Wei Jia.
\newblock Who are the money launderers? money laundering detection on
  blockchain via mutual learning-based graph neural network.
\newblock In {\em 2023 International Joint Conference on Neural Networks
  (IJCNN)}, pages 1--8. IEEE, 2023.

\bibitem{yu2021deescvhunter}
Xingxin Yu, Haoyue Zhao, Botao Hou, Zonghao Ying, and Bin Wu.
\newblock Deescvhunter: A deep learning-based framework for smart contract
  vulnerability detection.
\newblock In {\em 2021 International Joint Conference on Neural Networks
  (IJCNN)}, pages 1--8. IEEE, 2021.

\bibitem{zhan2019free}
Yufeng Zhan, Chi~Harold Liu, Yinuo Zhao, Jiang Zhang, and Jian Tang.
\newblock Free market of multi-leader multi-follower mobile crowdsensing: An
  incentive mechanism design by deep reinforcement learning.
\newblock {\em IEEE Transactions on Mobile Computing}, 19(10):2316--2329, 2019.

\bibitem{zhang2019lay}
Ren Zhang and Bart Preneel.
\newblock Lay down the common metrics: Evaluating proof-of-work consensus
  protocols' security.
\newblock In {\em 2019 IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy (SP)}, pages
  175--192. IEEE, 2019.

\bibitem{zhao2019secure}
Chuan Zhao, Shengnan Zhao, Minghao Zhao, Zhenxiang Chen, Chong-Zhi Gao, Hongwei
  Li, and Yu-an Tan.
\newblock Secure multi-party computation: theory, practice and applications.
\newblock {\em Information Sciences}, 476:357--372, 2019.

\bibitem{zhou2023visual}
Fangfang Zhou, Yunpeng Chen, Chunyao Zhu, Lijia Jiang, Xincheng Liao, Zengsheng
  Zhong, Xiaohui Chen, Yi~Chen, and Ying Zhao.
\newblock Visual analysis of money laundering in cryptocurrency exchange.
\newblock {\em IEEE Transactions on Computational Social Systems}, 2023.

Schwartz, Shalom H. and Rubel-Lifschitz, Tammy (2009): Cross-national variation in the size of sex differences in values: Effects of gender equality. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 97(1), 171–185.
Scott, William R. (2001): Institutions and organizations. 2nd edition. Sage Publications: Thousand Oaks i.a.
Siciliano, Julie I. (1996): The relationship of board member diversity to organizational performance. Journal of Business Ethics, 15(12), 1313–1320.
Silverman, Irwin W. (2003): Gender differences in delay of gratification: A meta-analysis. Sex Roles, 49(9/10), 451–463.
Simons, Starlene M. and Rowland, Kimberly N. (2011): Diversity and its impact on organizational performance: The influence of diversity constructions on expectations and outcomes. Journal of Technology Management & Innovation, 6(3), 171–183.

Neely Jr., Brett H; Lovelace, Jeffrey B.; Cowen, Amanda P. and Hiller, Nathan J. (2020): Metacritiques of upper echelons theory: Verdicts and recommendations for future research. Journal of Management, 46(6), 1029–1062.
North, Douglass C. (1990): Institutions, institutional change and economic performance. Cambridge University Press: Cambridge i.a.
O'Brien, Robert M. (2007): A caution regarding rules of thumb for variance inflation factors. Quality & Quantity: International Journal of Methodology, 41(5), 673–690.
OECD/Eurostat (Ed.) (2019): Oslo manual 2018: Guidelines for collecting, reporting and using data on innovation. 4th edition. OECD Publishing: Paris and Luxembourg.
O'Reilly, Charles and Chatman, Jennifer A. (1996): Culture and social control: corporations, cult and commitment. Research in Organizational Behavior, 18, 157–200.
